story.text: WASHINGTON Jan 3 A U.S. federal appeals court on Wednesday let stand an earlier ruling that reinstated a patent infringement case filed by a Schering AG SCHG.DE affiliate against Tyco Healthcare.The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit turned down a request to review its previous decision from October, without comment. In the earlier ruling, the appeals court reversed a decision by a lower court judge who had thrown out the case against Tyco Healthcare, a unit of Tyco International Ltd. (TYC.N). The patent case was filed in 2001 by Medrad Inc., a Schering affiliate based in Pennsylvania, and centers on an infusion system used with magnetic resonance imaging.
story.title: us court won ' t reconsider medrad patent case ruling
